messages.subject: Re: - great unschool phrases???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/18/02 3:10:06 PM, bingoqueen@sssnet.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/18/02 3:10:06 PM, bingoqueen@... writes:

<< I should have known not to ask this list for anything as always my post
has been ignored when I wanted the help and now a lecture given on why I
should or should not do something, that was not what my question was it was
does anyone have any great quotes. (my mistake for explaining why I wanted
them!) >>

This is tacky.

There are unschooling quotes at www.unschooling.com, and all over the
internet.

Go to www.google.com and put in learning quotes
or homeschooling quotes
or unschooling quotes

It seems lots of the posters here have quotes after their names.


But to complain about always being ignored here doesn't seem productive.

If you want people to help you exactly to your specifications, you have to
pay them money by the hour.

If you want free help you have to accept it the way it comes. Insulting your
volunteer helpers doesn't help make you a better person or make them want to
help you next time.

Sandra
